intro: Corchoropsis psilocarpa, commonly known as the red sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its seeds are enclosed in small, capsule-like fruits that split open to release the seeds. Corchoropsis psilocarpa is adapted to survive in harsh environments with minimal water availability.
